text: WENTY ECOND UNDAY I RDINARY IME UGUST 29 2021 This weekend August 28th29th the Church celebrates the Twenty second Sunday in Ordinary Time Having completed the Bread of Life Discourse we now return to the Gospel of St Mark We will continue to walk with the Lord through this gospel until the end of the liturgical year with the Solemnity of Christ the King in November As we continue this walk through the Gospel of St Mark our focus will be on the Christian life As we have already celebrated those great events eg the Incarnation the Resurrection etc that mark salvation history we now see the fruits of these events put into action As Christ has come into the world so now He sends His Church to proclaim the Good News And we as members of His Body proclaim this good news in our very lives PECIAL OLLECTION FOR AITI EPTEMBER 4TH 5TH Bishop Rhoades has asked all parishes to take up a special collection for the residents of Haiti As we have recently seen in the news Haiti has been subjected to a horrible earthquake and terrible storms that have caused much destruction We will have a basket marked for this special collection at the Church doors at all Masses next weekend September 4th 5th and additional donations marked for Haiti can be sent in to the Parish Office JOSEPH ATHOLIC EMETERY PDATE In the narthex there is a diagram of the new St Joseph Catholic Cemetery and a picture from the cemeterys infrastructure groundbreaking As you can see when you pass along IN124 construction for the cemetery is moving forward We are also in the process of obtaining quotes for monuments that would be placed in the cemetery such as an altarcrucifixion scene and depictions of the mysteries of the Rosary We will hold an informational Town Hall Meeting on the cemetery after the 7:30AM and 10 AM Masses on Sunday October 31st Jeff Lehmler of ThomaRich Lehmler Funeral Home will join us as we offer specifics about the cemetery and allow time for questions from the community We will hold the official Ground Blessing Ceremony at the cemetery on All Souls Day Tuesday November 2nd at 6 PM More information to come Faithfully in Christ Fr David ERESA MITH IRECTOR OF ACRED USIC AND ITURGY My name is Teresa Smith and I am so happy to be your new Director of Sacred Music and Liturgy I have been involved in Liturgical music for the last 28 years Cantoring singing in choirs directing Childrens Choirs and Adult Choirs My husband and I are the creators of Gregorian Chant for Kids and Traditional Hymns for Kids which are curriculums designed to help teach children the musical treasures of our Catholic faith I have also performed with my husband in our duo Crossed Hearts We were blessed to be signed with GIA Publications and traveled the country performing our Contemporary Catholic music at Youth and Educators Conferences and churches My husband David and I have 8 children whom weve home schooled and have 2 grandsons and 1 grand daughter arriving in September In my spare time I love to garden sew bake and watch old Sherlock Holmes movies I look forward to meeting everyone in the parish If you have any questions or just want to introduce yourself
